title: Question:
author: aioc
content: It's not that we cannot afford to buy PPV live of must-watch boxing matches but if you don't want to buy a PPV where and how do you watch your favorite live fights and matches.For me it's Facebook live streaming there are a lot of streamers that share their stream in the fight for a small donation, these streamers are wise they know what to do and how to configure their stream so Facebook will not catch them and disable their stream.I watched the most popular fight recently the Canelo - Ryder fight and it will be my choice for big fights how about you?

comments.author: tusandii
comments.body: Quote from: aioc on May 12, 2023, 01:26:47 PMIt's not that we cannot afford to buy PPV live of must-watch boxing matches but if you don't want to buy a PPV where and how do you watch your favorite live fights and matches.I usually watch live broadcasts of Boxing and MMA matches on television because in my country there are several television channels broadcasting matches and fights at various world and local events.When I'm not at home, I usually watch via Vidio.com and subscribe every month.I'm sure on YouTube you can also subscribe to be able to watch live sports broadcasts such as Boxing, MMA and many more.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: On facebook streaming page, problem only is a bit of a delay with the match but that's fine with me as long as the fight is continuous and there are no interruptions with the vid. I am one with those who cannot afford spending money for pay-per-view also, not really that of an avid van to spend more than what I use to bet. Result will come out in the first place and it is enough for me to just watch the game or fight with some delays. If it is just ethical concerns, live streams of a fight or match on facebook are stolen from the main service provider. So if such thing matters that much on your end, go with PPV to atleast give support to the operators of that much or the management itself. Also, on other platforms, such thing is prohibited which pushed me to settle with what I can access.

comments.author: ryzaadit
comments.body: Sometimes, I join MMA Community.Example Like "Discord" I also do the same things on F1. I don't pay for a subscription, some people are really kind to re-broadcasting the match to "Discord" so everyone can watch. However, there has some maximum people who can join the stream in "Discord".Maximum 50 people. In-case all room full, need to wait some guy opened another room and re-broadcasting ~LOL.

comments.author: Casdinyard
comments.body: Facebook streaming. And for a couple of reasons too!For one, the whole site is becoming less and less moderated due to the decline in active users, which means unsolicited fight streams get away with just being posted in there, and with no issues or fear of getting caught and receiving the ban hammer too!Second, it’s much like twitch now with all these donations and stars coming in that helps a streamer get by, and even though it’s not much, it’s definitely something and could inspire the streamer to do more of those in the future. Lastly, it’s free, and you can run it even in the weakest of computers. Facebook being built for much older devices makes it very friendly for users across the planet. So it generally offers high quality streaming, without taking up too much phone or PC ram. And yeah it’s cross platform too so you can watch it everywhere!

comments.author: bitzizzix
comments.body: It's getting harder and harder to watch boxing and MMA for free, let alone fights that matter. And when I try to look it up for free and can't, I have no choice but to watch it on YouTube even if it's a rebroadcast.I also sometimes open the Facebook streaming page to watch it, but sometimes important matches are not available and even if there are, the picture quality is not very clear and also the picture is unstable because the stream is taken from the television.and even though I love boxing and MMA fighting, especially boxing. But I didn't force it and didn't even try to do it because there is a last resort, I can watch it even if it's a rebroadcast.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Like the majority here I watch important MMA and boxing matches through Facebook streamers its easy to find them all you have to do is to type in the name of the matches and add the word live and you'll find a lot of streamers I like those streamers who ask for donations because you can watch the whole fight with covering the stream they know how to make their live stream online for the whole matches without getting page flagged.They also make money from donations we are ok with that compared to if you're going to shell out money to buy a live fight, it may look unethical but they invested money and effort and risk of getting their page flagged.

And when I try to look it up for free and can't, I have no choice but to watch it on YouTube even if it's a rebroadcast.I also sometimes open the Facebook streaming page to watch it, but sometimes important matches are not available and even if there are, the picture quality is not very clear and also the picture is unstable because the stream is taken from the television.and even though I love boxing and MMA fighting, especially boxing. But I didn't force it and didn't even try to do it because there is a last resort, I can watch it even if it's a rebroadcast.^Definitely right because of that matter or depend on our location and the broadcasting rights in our country.Sometimes FaceBook will automatically shut down those live streams if they found out that it is unauthorized live streams. I think in watching free live matches on Facebook we should be careful, sometimes there are malicious links that they put into it that could be at risk to our devices. I think some sportsbooks offer a free live match to watch as long as you are a player to them.

comments.author: Saint-loup
comments.body: Quote from: ryzaadit on May 12, 2023, 05:42:08 PMSometimes, I join MMA Community.Example Like "Discord" I also do the same things on F1. In-case all room full, need to wait some guy opened another room and re-broadcasting ~LOL.Thank you for the tips but how do you find those Discord channels please?For MMA, especially UFC, Stake broadcasts every fights freely (you don't need to place any bet for that) if your country is allowed for those streams. If not you can use a VPN and the stream should be available. If the VPN is a free one with a low speed, the stream may lag though.

comments.author: harizen
comments.body: Quote from: aioc on May 12, 2023, 01:26:47 PMIt's not that we cannot afford to buy PPV live of must-watch boxing matches but if you don't want to buy a PPV where and how do you watch your favorite live fights and matches.Try to search if there's an available "general forum" dedicated to your locals. There should be a sports section there.Sometimes, there are good samaritans there that share free streaming links. It's better to hunt those links as it has the same quality as live match (in most cases) and are almost synchronized with the live match. There's no also annoying streamer there like on Facebook shared streams.Anyways, if you are used to watching Facebook shared live stream if you have time, try also to browse a stream where there is no commentator from the live sharer. Sometimes, it can be found on the small sports page. But if no choice, then will really end up at those with have streamers.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: I have two ways to watch my favorite boxing matches and UFC matches, from a friend's house if he buys a PPV and he invited me which is very often, nothing like having a drink and exchanging thoughts while the fight is ongoing, the second is from a Facebook live streaming, there are many streamers who are doing this, it's a give and take they show the live stream, you send a donation or a star.Facebook streaming is very popular because there's little chance that it will be taken down if the streamers can do it right, like changing the speed of the voice of the announcers and resizing the screen of the stream so the Facebook bot will not catch it.It may look like an infringement of a copyright but many of us don't want to subscribe to PPV so this is one of the options.

comments.author: stomachgrowls
comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on May 12, 2023, 11:16:44 PMI have two ways to watch my favorite boxing matches and UFC matches, from a friend's house if he buys a PPV and he invited me which is very often, nothing like having a drink and exchanging thoughts while the fight is ongoing, the second is from a Facebook live streaming, there are many streamers who are doing this, it's a give and take they show the live stream, you send a donation or a star.Facebook streaming is very popular because there's little chance that it will be taken down if the streamers can do it right, like changing the speed of the voice of the announcers and resizing the screen of the stream so the Facebook bot will not catch it.It may look like an infringement of a copyright but many of us don't want to subscribe to PPV so this is one of the options.I do actually relate into this because there's always that one inside the circle of friends which are really die hard fans of MMA or BOXING which i do ask out if ever they do have that livestream or able to pay up on PPV's on which i do really tend to ask out but since we are friends for a long time then it turns out to be a casual thing and my friend arent really that having that bad feeling if i do just tend to go into their houseand watch together and the fact that it would be more enjoyable if you do go watch together with your friends rather than on watching it alone. Although i could afford on paying up that PPVbut i could just simply go into my friends house not to have some freebie or free of charge watch but to enjoy it together with friends. If i dont able to see it live then there's always that replay as long im not really that get spoiled early.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Whenever I make a bet especially on anticipated boxing and MMA matches, I really want to watch it live. It feels odd when you have a bet and you will only watch the replays. It's not that fun. And since I don't have access to PPV most of the time, I will have to resort to those who are live streaming without permit. I used to watch live fights through crackstreams, but then the site was seized by government authorities. I moved to sportsurge. As far as NBA games are concerned, it is always available through Facebook.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Discord usually if there were some kind people enough to show it. I got linked to a few Facebook lives in the past as well so usually those two when I was alone. I've had experiences where me and my friends meetup to watch it together (or in Discord as well, whatever works really), whoever usually buys the ticket and shares decides where we go watch it, it's pretty fun. Haven't really paid for the last few ones I've watched, my passion for watching it died down quite a bit so I just watch whenever one of my friends wants some company to watch with.

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: Quote from: aioc on May 12, 2023, 01:26:47 PMIt's not that we cannot afford to buy PPV live of must-watch boxing matches but if you don't want to buy a PPV where and how do you watch your favorite live fights and matches.For me it's Facebook live streaming there are a lot of streamers that share their stream in the fight for a small donation, these streamers are wise they know what to do and how to configure their stream so Facebook will not catch them and disable their stream.I watched the most popular fight recently the Canelo - Ryder fight and it will be my choice for big fights how about you?There’s a bunch of free streaming website available on the internet if you will be patient checking it all but if you want a more convenient way then you need to pay a little bit for the premium. IPTV subscription is the one I’m using right now because it cover all the premium sports channel without the need to purchase the actual premium cost. I’m tired clicking on the ads from free streaming website while facebook streamer usually interrupted when they are detected by facebook moderator.There’s a lot of users offering IPTV premium subscription with minimal cost. I still have some that will gonna expired this November that I get on our local forum that is related for gadgets technology. Try to browse on your local forum(outside forum that focus on tech) because some user typically drop some free IPTV subscription in there to save money although the premium subs is not that expensive compared to the actual cost of the channels subs.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Quote from: aioc on May 12, 2023, 01:26:47 PMIt's not that we cannot afford to buy PPV live of must-watch boxing matches but if you don't want to buy a PPV where and how do you watch your favorite live fights and matches.For me it's Facebook live streaming there are a lot of streamers that share their stream in the fight for a small donation, these streamers are wise they know what to do and how to configure their stream so Facebook will not catch them and disable their stream.I watched the most popular fight recently the Canelo - Ryder fight and it will be my choice for big fights how about you?There too if I miss subscribing for pay-per-view or just endure the small screen from Stake.com which offers almost live streaming of the game/fight. A lot of websites do offer free streaming but I would be careful with them if I were you. First, in the advertisements, a lot of pop-ups will come out. Then, there's the security issue, you don't know what your computer could get with those websites. Instead of that, I would rather watch full replays and there are a lot of websites that also save copies of the fight without ads coming out. Just try to google full replays and you will find it in the first page.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: Easy to watch and find friends who are also watching the match when you are on facebook, I Once tried sharing the streaming link and found my friends also watching and good to see the, comment to live stream.  They are also betting as well but on other platform.Although I can see bookies have live streaming services, its no fun when it loads slow.

comments.author: len01
comments.body: usually I watch MMA on Facebook streaming more often or if I'm lazy to open Facebook I choose to watch via YouTube. but for me actually watching MMA is more convenient for me on Facebook, I only need to follow a page that often broadcasts live MMA and when there is a match there is usually always a notification from Facebook that a match is in progress. so don't miss any MMA match.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: I don't really focused on boxing or even place bet, sometimes i feels like to start going into it because a friends of mine told me is more reliable to bet on than sports betting like football. I will suggest for those who really wants to watch it live can hookup through Youtube or stream them live. Although i just made a little research on app to stream live boxing matches and i found this UFC Live Streams Please note that i am not trying to promote any site or app, due to the question i made a quick search to get a free app or site to stream a live boxing match, also I have never used it before or even download it to my device.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: What are you watching on a podcast? you're watching a guy who's watching the match, it's boring and we're don't know what exactly happen on the match if we're not watch it with your eyes. So if you're not buy a PPV live or your country don't have a channel to access boxing and MMA matches, the only one solution is watching illegally from someone who willing to share it. Or you can watch the replay too.
